title: Drawing, "Interior of a Fantastic Mausoleum", 1742–46
medium: Pen and brown and gray ink, brush and wash, watercolor, black chalk on paper, lined with various sheets of paper with printed text in French
signed: Signed at lower left in brown ink (illegible)
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower right: ROME
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Depiction of a church interior.  The view shown from an oblique angle, depicts a vast, vaulted hall that leads into another, colonnaded hall.  A sepulchral monument is positioned above the arched opening (at the transition to the next hall).  Numerous sculptures and monuments are positioned in wall niches in the main hall. Three small figures and a dog are standing at center.  Additional groups of people are visible in the distance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Interior of a Fantastic Mausoleum", 1742–46.
1742–46. Pen and brown and gray ink, brush and wash, watercolor, black chalk on paper, lined with various sheets of paper with printed text in French. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-444.
